org.jimmutable.core.objects

Class StandardImmutableObject<T extends StandardImmutableObject<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jimmutable.core.objects.StandardObject<T>
      • org.jimmutable.core.objects.StandardImmutableObject<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<T>, org.jimmutable.core.serialization.writer.StandardWritable

    public abstract class StandardImmutableObject<T extends StandardImmutableObject<T>>
extends org.jimmutable.core.objects.StandardObject<T>
    An abstract base class for standard objects that want to guarantee immutability.

    A standard immutable object may only be modified before it is complete().

    Note: It is important that the normalization code goes into normalize(), the validation code into StandardObject.validate(), and the freezing code into freeze(). The latter is particularly important as deep cloning (and hence building) rely upon the ability to control the timing of these operations.

    Author:
    Jim Kane

    • Method Detail

      • freeze

        public abstract void freeze()
        Make any changes to this object required to make this object immutable. Frequently the only job of freeze is to call freeze() on any non-primative fields.
        See Also:
        Field.freeze()

      • complete

        public void complete()
        Declare that an object is ready to use. In addition to normal complete() completion, freeze() is called to toggle immutability.

        isComplete() is guaranteed to return true after complete has returned.

        complete can only be called once for immutable objects. Future invocations will result in an ImmutableException.

        Overrides:
        complete in class org.jimmutable.core.objects.StandardObject<T extends StandardImmutableObject<T>>
        Throws:
        org.jimmutable.core.exceptions.ImmutableException - if the object is complete

      • assertNotComplete

        Test to see if the object is complete
        Throws:
        org.jimmutable.core.exceptions.ImmutableException - if the object is complete
